means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 库克职业名称，来源于古英语，含义是“厨师”(cook)
[地名] [澳大利亚、美国] 库克

sentence.Network_en: Captain Cook safely navigated his ship without accident for 100 voyages.
sentence.Network_cn: 库克船长驾驶的船安全出航100次无事故。

sentence.Network_en: He said that what they were up to would cook Krasky's goose.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说他们暗中进行的阴谋可能会使克拉斯基的计划流产。

sentence.Network_en: Put the onions in the pan and cook until lightly browned.
sentence.Network_cn: 将洋葱放入平底锅内，炒至略呈棕色。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)alter facts or figures dishonestly or illegally

(非正式)（使某人的计划等）受挫；使垮台

phrase.cizu_name: too many cooks spoil the broth

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)if too many people are involved in a task or activity, it will not be done well
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)厨师多了烧坏汤；人多反坏事

jx.jx_cn_mean: 策划；捏造（情况，理由，计划）

lj.lj_ly: The speeding ticket cooked his goose with his father. Her goose was cooked when she was caught cheating on the test.
lj.lj_ls: 超速驾驶罚款单使他在他父亲那儿倒了霉。当她考试作弊被抓住时，一下名声扫地

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cōc (noun), from popular Latin cocus, from Latin coquus

entry.def: When you cook a meal, you prepare food for eating by heating it.

example.ex: I have to go and cook the dinner...
Chefs at the St James Court restaurant have cooked for the Queen...
example.tran: 圣詹姆斯皇家饭店的厨师们曾经为女王烹制菜肴。

entry.def: When you cook food, or when food cooks, it is heated until it is ready to be eaten.

example.ex: ...some basic instructions on how to cook a turkey...
example.tran: 烹饪火鸡的一些基本的做法指导

example.ex: Let the vegetables cook gently for about 10 minutes...
example.tran: 用小火将蔬菜煮大约10分钟。

entry.def: A cook is a person whose job is to prepare and cook food, especially in someone's home or in an institution.

example.ex: They had a butler, a cook, and a maid.
example.tran: 他们有一个男管家、一个厨师和一个女佣。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a good cook, you mean they are good at preparing and cooking food.
If you say that someone has cooked the books, you mean that they have changed figures or a written record in order to deceive people.

means.word_mean: 2. prepare for eating by applying heat;
3. transform and make suitable for consumption by heating;

sentences.sentence: "These potatoes have to cook for 20 minutes"
"The apothecary cooked the medicinal mixture in a big iron kettle"

auth_sentence.content: Bring to a simmer and cook for five minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bring to a simmer and cook for five minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bring to a simmer and cook for five minutes.

auth_sentence.content: Cook for a further minute, then keep warm.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cook for a further minute, then keep warm.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cook for a further minute, then keep warm.

auth_sentence.content: Transfer to the oven and cook for ten minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Transfer to the oven and cook for ten minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Transfer to the oven and cook for ten minutes.

Sentence.sentence: Fire was one of the earliest major technological advances for humankind, providing heat, protection, and cooked food (which is much easier to cat and digest).
City officials cooperated with the 4-H members in planting trees, building cooking facilities, pick-me tables, swings and public rest rooms.
They set up cooking facilities near it

sentences.en: Meat cooks more slowly than vegetables.
It took me about two hours to cook the meat.
sentences.cn: 我花了大约两个小时来煮这些肉。

sentences.en: Mother cooked us a good meal.
sentences.cn: 妈妈给我们做了一顿可口的饭。

sentences.en: Please cook a cake for the little boy.
sentences.cn: 请给这个小男孩做个蛋糕。

sentences.en: He is quite capable of cooking the evidence.
sentences.cn: 编造这个证据足以证明他很有才能。

sentences.en: My mother is a terrific cook!
We have secured a first class cook.
sentences.cn: 我们已经请到了一位第一流的厨师。

jushi.english: Every woman should learn to cook.
jushi.chinese: 每一位妇女都应该学会做饭。

jushi.english: I will cook all day tomorrow.
